posts.content:
I would like to play a Pm build that eventually gets a Demi Lich and I have been looking at different builds. To get the 30 PM levels it seems very difficult to obtain any type of decent AB so I decided to take as many Wiz levels as i could and try to make a char that can buff its summons and has a few good spell DCs. I appreciate it will only have a caster level of 9 but I think it will do ok against melee types.
I have taken SP/GSP and ESP to get a little more which could help against non boss types, and the SF/GSF and ESF feats are to up my DCs for Conj and Necro spells which will give me a few decent offensive spells.
I will obvioulsy rely on summons from my early teens and I have chosen to take all the Epic Spells rather than Energy reduction feats so I have more summons in an emergency and for killing off with GR.

My worry is that I am not gong to have enough punch espcially in the middle of its life and that I am perhaps putting too much into INT for the DC and leaving me with less DEX and reduced AC. That also makes m wonder if I do inc dex whether I should go Finesse and Focus and make some attempt at hitting things? Should I take Craft Wand to have more spells at my disposal and to help buff my summons?
I took LoH rather than toughness and feel it is much of a muchness for which would help more. I now think maybe Hellball is not as useful as taking ESF Conj?

My primary goal is to obtain the Demi Lich, the rest I can live with or without so long as it gets me to my primary goal.

Any thoughts? Help? Advice? Anyone tried anything similar? I looked at the old Epi Build search engine and found nothing with 30 PM levels that was similar or helpful.

thx in advance....

posts.author: DragonatorXII
posts.content: Expertise and Improved Expertise could be good options, for free +10 AC. From there, buff your summons and let them rock. With all that PM I suspect you get bonus spell sltos of higher level spells, so learn the spells through scrolls. Issacs, Firebrand, Horrid Wilting, good evocations are your friend.

posts.author: linestotheliving
posts.content:
DragonatorXII wrote:Expertise and Improved Expertise could be good options, for free +10 AC. From there, buff your summons and let them rock. With all that PM I suspect you get bonus spell sltos of higher level spells, so learn the spells through scrolls. Issacs, Firebrand, Horrid Wilting, good evocations are your friend.
I had considered Expertise, but as I felt I would be casting it isn't an option because the server I play on frowns on casters taking it. It would also be difficult to choose two feats to drop for Exp and Imp Exp. I feel the SP line is necessary because of only having 9 caster levels, but after mid levels the SP wont really be helpful except against lower level mobs. I can't see too many bosses being troubled by my spells that are opposed by SR. It is also why I went SF in two schools to get my DCs a bit higher for spells such as Horrid Wilting, Wail of the Banshee, etc. Scrolls are easy to obtain so getting spells wont be a problem and things such as Mords (the breach effect) and Time Stop which I will use a lot are not opposed so caster level isn't so much of an issue. I also considered changing one SF line to evocation but feel if I am tactical with my spell choice I can get by even with only 9(15) effective caster levels. I could however, drop LoH and my rogue level to take Wizard 10 and get another feat to add SF and GSF Evocation. I would lose my trap skills and UMD, but in all honesty I am a useless rogue player and always forget or do something that wastes the time I spend setting traps.The UMD would not be such a great loss either because most gear I would use I can use without it. The loss of some Tumble wouldn't be good though. Not convinced by my own argument there though!!!!
Am I right in that line of thought?

posts.author: Nokteronoth
posts.content:
With Arelith, it's hard to choose between necromancy and evocation and conjuration. I have a hard time doing it, but I suggest you don't get both Necromancy AND conjuration. They both boost your buffs to summoning, conjuration to living, and necromancy to the undead. 30 nets you with a LEsser Demilich, who gets buffed, and if you get Epic Spell" Dragon Knight, you get a dracolich. You will get to summon 2 demiliches as per Epic Spell Focus, as one of them will count as a henchman (Which the dragon will too)

http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Lesser_demilich

You may want to keep to the Alhoon Elder, it's up to you.

And Expertise/Improved Expertise aren't frowned upon, casters just find them impractical anymore. If you're in a mode like Expertise, it drops you from it whenever you go to cast a spell. (This was to stop AC tank mages and Warlocks from being nearly impossible to take on.)

~Nok

posts.author: Nokteronoth
posts.content:
My bad! Personally I'd bust for either the Bard/PM or else Wiz/Rogue/PM for the Tumble. (The extra Tumble AC really does help a lot.) And once you INT was high enough, you could have decent sneaking to go along with your summons. Summon, buff, sneak behind them..or in front. On servers where True Seeing isn't permanent or that easy to cast over and over, most people won't think to look for a hiding ~and~ invisible mage.

~Nok
